top.title: Bosch to invest more than $2.9 billion in AI
top.snippet:
Robert Bosch GmbH plans to invest more than $2.9 billion in artificial intelligence (AI) through 2027, according to company statements and media reports published Jan. 6. It’s betting that the technology will help increase productivity and support new products. The investment reflects its effort to expand its use of software and data-driven technologies across its […]
The post Bosch to invest more than $2.9 billion in AI appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

top.title: Most consumers interacted with AI customer service during holiday shopping
top.snippet: Consumers’ response to AI and automation is largely positive, but a majority still say humans provide better support, a Liveops survey found.

top.title: 2026 will prove whether AI checkout is here to stay
top.snippet: 2025 showed that more shoppers were eager and willing to start their shopping journeys on AI engines like ChatGPT and Perplexity. Now, 2026 will be the year that proves whether shoppers have gotten comfortable enough with the technology to click "buy" within these AI platforms.

top.title: Why the AI shopping agent wars will heat up in 2026
top.snippet: As retailers and tech giants race to build AI shopping agents, 2026 is shaping up as a pivotal year to see whether consumers embrace these tools — or whether hype outpaces real-world adoption.

top.title: AI and the Human Condition
top.snippet: AI might replace all of the jobs; that's only a problem if you think that humans will care, but if they care, they will create new jobs.

top.title: Five Trends in AI and Data Science for 2026
top.snippet: Carolyn Geason-Beissel/MIT SMR | Getty Images Organizations tend to change much more slowly than AI technology does these days. This means that forecasting enterprise adoption of AI is a bit easier than predicting technology change in this, our third year of making AI predictions. top.title: CVS Health details AI-driven digital strategy
top.snippet:
CVS Health has outlined a broad digital and artificial intelligence (AI) strategy aimed at simplifying health care delivery. The strategy deepens consumer engagement and supports multiyear earnings growth. It positions technology as a core driver of the company’s next phase rather than a back-office function. At its 2025 investor day in December, the health care […]
The post CVS Health details AI-driven digital strategy appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.

top.title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
top.snippet: At the CES conference, Jensen Huang, the company’s chief executive, said the more efficient and powerful chip would begin shipping later this year.

top.title: Visa, Mastercard track roughly 4% US holiday retail sales growth
top.snippet: The 2025 holiday season saw consumers shopping across channels to land the best deals and maximize convenience, according to new reports.

top.title: Brands are upset that ‘Buy For Me’ is featuring their products on Amazon without permission
top.snippet: Online merchants say Amazon’s “Buy for Me” AI tool listed their products without permission, forcing them to opt out after the fact and raising concerns about brand control, customer trust and the impact of AI on shopping.

top.title: 5 Content Marketing Ideas for February 2026
top.snippet:
Valentine's Day, Presidents' Day, and the start of the spring buying cycle offer content opportunities in February 2026.
The post 5 Content Marketing Ideas for February 2026 appeared first on Practical Ecommerce.

top.title: Could Nike sell Converse?
top.snippet: Revenue declines and a 44% drop in demand creation may indicate it’s time to divest the brand, according to BNP Paribas.

top.title: Selena Gomez’s Rare Beauty to launch at Ulta
top.snippet: The beauty brand will be available online and at the retailer's stores starting in February, with exclusive offerings and a donation campaign.

top.title: Will protein fatigue hit in 2026?
top.snippet: As major food manufacturers hop on the high-protein bandwagon, consumers are beginning to question the need for protein in so many products.

Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge receives MBE
top.snippet:
British jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge has been awarded a Mem­ber of the Order of the Brit­ish Empire (MBE) for her ser­vices to design. As always, these awards are handed out dur­ing the year by King Charles III and mem­bers of the royal fam­ily. Based in London, Azagury-Partridge runs her own jewellery brand Solange, with a […]
The post Jewellery designer Solange Azagury-Partridge receives MBE appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Recognition of a prominent jewellery designer's achievements

top.title: Tiffany rides into 2026 Chinese New Year with campaign
top.snippet:
Tiffany & Co has unveiled its 2026 Chinese New Year campaign, uniting a Pegasus motif with the House’s most celebrated designs to mark the arrival of a new year. The campaign features a Pegasus motif inspired by a brooch created under the artistic direction of Nathalie Verdeille, chief artistic officer, and rooted in the imaginative world of Jean Schlumberger. The campaign […]
The post Tiffany rides into 2026 Chinese New Year with campaign appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Tiffany's campaign highlights cultural significance in jewellery

top.title: Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026
top.snippet:
As we enter into 2026, inflation rates are increasing as prices continued to edge up at the end of last year. According to the British Retail Consortium, shop price inflation picked up to 0.7% year on year in December, against growth of 0.6% in November. This is in line with the 3-month average of 0.7%. […]
The post Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026 appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
top.rerankWhy: Inflation impacts on jewellery pricing and retail

top.title: How indie retailers will shape the high street in 2026
top.snippet:
One of the things I love most about working with independent retailers is their resilience and adaptability.
